p: The three rearing substrates exhibited different accumulation patterns of minerals (Table 3). Five major minerals, i.e. required in amounts greater >100 mg/day, were detected. Of those, phosphorus (DF = 2; F = 82.18; R 2 = 0.982; p = 0.0024), magnesium (DF = 2; F = 63.38; R 2 = 0.934; p < 0.0001) and sodium (DF = 2; F = 237.67; R 2 = 0.981; p < 0.0001) significantly differed among the tested BSFL whereas potassium and calcium did not.
